metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34480 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Within the lg_init() function, if several allocations succeed but then one fails, an uninitialized pointer would have been freed despite never being allocated. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro libnss3 - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.15 libnss3-tools - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.15 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
nss package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.35-2ubuntu2.15').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
